root.pub-comments: "The macro-Je cluster is the best supported of all South American clusters. There is good reason for believing all the languages listed below to be related, and detailed comparative work should be carried out. The time depth may not be as great as Swadesh's estimates might suggest. Davis and Rodrigues both point to connections with Tupian, while Swadesh includes Chikitano-Bororoan in his more inclusive 'macro-Tupi'. Comparative work has been done on 'macro-Je'; Davis (1968) assembles sixty-seven cognates sets between proto-Je, Mashakali, and Karaja, and xetracts sound correspondences from them, but does not propose a proto-'macro-Je' phonological system. Davis makes about ten comparisons between proto-Je and proto-Tupi." (72)
root.publications: Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 72-73. London, New York: Routledge.
